content: Which famous composer, known for his symphonies and chamber music, began losing his hearing at age 26 but continued to compose masterpieces?

Ludwig van Beethoven is the renowned composer you're referring to. Despite beginning to lose his hearing at a relatively young age, he continued to create some of the most profound and influential music in classical history. His ability to persevere through such personal adversity and still produce masterpieces is a testament to his extraordinary talent and resilience.
